The expert: s analysis of the claim: The expert provides a detailed analysis of the claim made by President Trump during a political rally in Wisconsin, stating that doctors and pregnant women meet to decide whether to "execute" newborn babies. The expert concludes that this statement is false and incendiary.
Comparison to previous statements: The expert highlights that this claim is similar to a previous statement made by Trump on Twitter in February 2019 when Senate Democrats blocked the "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act." This comparison helps to contextualize the claim and its potential motivations.
Reference to state: level law: The expert mentions that Trump's statement was referencing a veto by Democratic Gov. Tony Evers of a state-level law in Wisconsin that mirrored the federal "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act." This reference provides a specific context for the claim and its connection to ongoing political debates.
Expert opinion and legal perspective: The expert, Dr. Daniel Grossman, provides his professional opinion that executing newborn babies would be illegal and refers to the case of Kermit Gosnell, who was convicted of murder for similar actions. The expert also emphasizes that if a fetus survives an abortion, it must be cared for in the same manner as any other baby of the same gestational age, according to the law. This expert opinion adds credibility and expertise to the analysis of the claim.
